Igloofest Surprises Followers With Brand-New Edition Located in Quebec

Posted by Brittany Prevost on December 15, 2021
TICKETS
Igloofest is pulling out all stops for their high-anticipated 15th anniversary edition! In addition to the exciting unveiling of its official after parties, the organizers also recently revealed a huge surprise! 
In the new year, the coldest music festival in the world will be touching down at a new location! On March 16th, 18th and 19th, 2022, the Place Jean-Béliveau, in Quebec, QC, will host three events, guaranteed to please even the toughest dance music critics!
On March 16, 2022, get ready to witness a special performance by Montreal-native KAYTRANADA. Lou Phelps, who's also a Haitian-Canadian record producer, and LOU FRE$H will be on opening duties. You won't want to miss it!
On March 18, 2022, kick off your weekend with a night of headbanging! Canadian duo Zeds Dead will be your headliners! Don't forget to grab your neck braces as DEATHPACT and Rossy are billed to support. If history has taught us anything, these acts will be wild! 
One of the world's leading electronic music acts, Above & Beyond, are gearing up to transport attendees thanks to their well-known trance anthems. You'll want to hold your friends close when Sinca and gardenstate unleash some equally touching tracks. 
In true Igloofest fashion, sport your cozy clothing and take in the frosty decor in the heart of ExpoCité. We can't wait to dance under the stars with our Flag fam! Passes (valid for 3 evenings) go on sale tomorrow here, Thursday, December 16, 2021, at 10:00 a.m. EST. 
To stay up-to-date on all things Igloofest, be sure to follow their official social media platforms. In addition, we encourage you to click "Interested" on the below Facebook events as many details are revealed within the discussion section. 
  • Igloofest Québec #1: KAYTRANADA, Lou Phelps (DJ Set), LOU FRE$H (DJ Set)
  • Igloofest Québec #3: Above & Beyond, gardenstate, Sinca
  • Igloofest Québec #2: Zeds Dead, Deathpact, ROSSY

Written By Brittany Prevost
